title: What is your champion Pool for Season 7

embed.description: gravityhacker / Silver 2 81LP / 756W 732L Win Ratio 51% / Twisted Fate - 107W 88L Win Ratio 55%, Caitlyn - 57W 54L Win Ratio 51%, Master Yi - 34W 40L Win Ratio 46%, Zac - 31W 25L Win Ratio 55%, Annie - 30W 26L Win Ratio 54%

body:
For me my champion pool is Zac/Maokai Jungle, Annie and lissandra mid. Trundle/Poppy Top 
Soraka if i get autofilled.

replies.body:
Feeling like I'm going to play;
Top - Poppy, Kennen, Maybe sion or jayce
Mid - Lux, Ahri, Ori
ADC - Jinx, Ezreal and Lucian, what else do you need

Of course if there is any big changes I'll have to change things up

Wukong/Renekton/Irelia/Nasus Top

Wukong/Hecarim/Vi Jungle 

Vayne/Ashe/Jhin Bot

> [{quoted}](name=A steezy Scizor,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=A4jETzs0,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-25T07:54:44.457+0000)
>
> 

The preseason is for testing the meta, and these champions are pretty strong for my current elo range. (Zac is strong at all elo's) What is your issue with chosing your champion pool during preseason?

> [{quoted}](name=gravityhacker,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=A4jETzs0,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-11-25T08:00:05.059+0000)
>
> The preseason is for testing the meta, and these champions are pretty strong for my current elo range. (Zac is strong at all elo's) What is your issue with chosing your champion pool during preseason?

the issue is the meta changes over the course of the season. you think pro's only play the same few champs over the course of the year? no, they play whatever's strong, and so should you, and if you don't you should be banned for playing something that's not the best champ in that role.

> [{quoted}](name=A steezy Scizor,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=A4jETzs0,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2016-11-25T11:29:28.830+0000)
>
> the issue is the meta changes over the course of the season. you think pro's only play the same few champs over the course of the year? no, they play whatever's strong, and so should you, and if you don't you should be banned for playing something that's not the best champ in that role.

Also, Zac is extremely strong right now..... And pro's have their core champs too.
This isn't pro play, and that is entirely not how this game works.

Mid: Akali, Velk, Syndra 
Jg: Elise, Amumu, olaf

If autofilled:
Top: Kennen
Sup: Zilean, Raka
Adc: MF, Ashe

Quinn. Just Quinn.

Why would I need anyone else?
Nami/Lulu supp, Zyra/Vel'Koz Mid, Kindred/Maokai Jng :)

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=A4jETzs0,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-25T07:51:17.221+0000)
>
> Nami/Lulu supp, Zyra/Vel'Koz Mid, Kindred/Maokai Jng :)

Ah the old zyra mid, i hate you haha ( really annoying to play against for me as i am not good at countering the damage from plants and hard to squash seeds as the zyra will instantly q me and i get mass damage from plants) 
also i like the maokai jung pick :) 

Also, you're daring with kindred jung lol, pretty difficult champ to play, but best of luck with ranked next season (although this just my opinion, i think you should swap kindred for zac as they have a very similar playstyle)

I'm terrible at cs, but have played Zyra and Vel extensively in support so they're safe picks for me since I know how to play them and they have good wave clear :P I also absolutely HATE vsing Yasuo so Zyra is a good counter to have.

Honestly I'm pretty hit and miss with Kindred, so Maokai is my safe pick, I don't queue as jng though, they're more just a safety in the rare event I get autofilled into it, which is practically never since my support main status grants me near constant immunity.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=A4jETzs0,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-25T08:09:45.090+0000)
>
> I'm terrible at cs, but have played Zyra and Vel extensively in support so they're safe picks for me since I know how to play them and they have good wave clear :P I also absolutely HATE vsing Yasuo so Zyra is a good counter to have.
> 
> Honestly I'm pretty hit and miss with Kindred, so Maokai is my safe pick, I don't queue as jng though, they're more just a safety in the rare event I get autofilled into it, which is practically never since my support main status grants me near constant immunity.

That's true, my safety pick for autofill is soraka, a straight forward and simple support.

She's a good safe pick. I struggle with Soraka because I like to play aggressively and it never ends well for me when I play Soraka :P It's amazing how differently we play just by being in a less comfortable position.

Season 1: ADC.
Season 2: Mages.
Season 3: Assassins.
Season 4: ADC.
Season 5: ADC.
Season 6: Mages.
Season 7: May go for support this season.
I play almost every champ. Tend to get bored maining champs.

**Solo/duo queue**
Main role will still likely be support so Nami, Morgana, Lulu, Sona, Karma, Janna + working on getting braum and bard skills good enough for consistent ranked play

Secondary role probably mid? I've only had to play mid about 10 times when queuing up as a solo/duo player in the past season. Likely will play Lux or Ahri, or even more likely dodge or barter for support. 

**flex queue**
Will be playing in a 5man at a level much lower than solo ranking, good opportunity to strengthen my weaker roles. 

_ADC:_ Miss Fortune, Caitlyn, Tristana, Sivir

Can't decide if mid or top for secondary role yet. 
_If mid_: Lux, Zyra, Ahri, Brand
_If top:_ Illaoi, Irelia, LIssandra, Poppy

I still haven't formally reviewed all my stats for this season and identified what I'm going to work on for next, all I know is that I have set my goal to reach diamond in season 7. When picking my champion pool I like to make sure I have champions that I work well with, am confident in the match-ups and are able to last pick knowing that I can fill in whats missing from a team comp (tank/sustain/poke/engage/disengage). 

Season 7 will mark my 3rd year of playing league, I should probably learn how to jungle as well :D

> [{quoted}](name=Yaiamone,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=A4jETzs0,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-11-25T08:02:32.264+0000)

When picking my champion pool I like to make sure I have champions that I work well with, am confident in the match-ups and are able to last pick knowing that I can fill in whats missing from a team comp (tank/sustain/poke/engage/disengage). 
> 
> Season 7 will mark my 3rd year of playing league, I should probably learn how to jungle as well :D

I like the picks (yeah, not many people like support so it's unlikely to get off role,  me personally i like basic junglers with easy but strong cc (hence zac and maokai) and very good ability for early ganks/protection of carries. Same with mid i need to play more simple champions (hence annie liss) as i want to actually improve this season.
